001 
002/**
003 * This class is part of the "World of Zuul" application. 
004 * "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game.  
005 * 
006 * This class holds an enumeration table of all command words known to the game.
007 * It is used to recognise commands as they are typed in.
008 *
009 * @author  A.Tsundyk
010 * @version 7.34
011 */
012public class CommandWords
013{
014    // a constant array that will hold all valid command words
015    private final String[] aValidCommands;
016
017    /**
018     * Constructor - initialise the command words.
019     */
020    public CommandWords()
021    {
022        this.aValidCommands = new String[13];
023        this.aValidCommands[0] = "go";
024        this.aValidCommands[1] = "aide";
025        this.aValidCommands[2] = "quitter";
026        this.aValidCommands[3] = "regarder";
027        this.aValidCommands[4] = "manger";
028        this.aValidCommands[5] = "retour";
029        this.aValidCommands[6] = "test";
030        this.aValidCommands[7] = "prendre";
031        this.aValidCommands[8] = "laisser";
032        this.aValidCommands[9] = "inventaire";
033        this.aValidCommands[10] = "charger";
034        this.aValidCommands[11] = "activer";
035        this.aValidCommands[12] = "reponse";
036    } 
037
038    /**
039     * Check whether a given String is a valid command word. 
040     * @return true if a given string is a valid command,
041     * false if it isn't.
042     */
043    public boolean isCommand( final String pString )
044    {
045        for ( int vI=0; vI<this.aValidCommands.length; vI++ ) {
046            if ( this.aValidCommands[vI].equals( pString ) )
047                return true;
048        } 
049        
050        return false;
051    } 
052    
053    /**
054     * Affiche toutes les commandes valides.
055     */
056    public String getCommandList()
057    {
058        String vResult =" ";
059        for(String command : aValidCommands){
060            vResult += command+ " ";
061        }
062        return vResult;
063    }
064    
065} // CommandWords
